title: Gradient, Divergence, and Curl: Medium Level
description: Answer all questions. Each carries 1 mark. Choose the most appropriate option.

questions.title: The volume integral $I = \iiint_{V} \vec{A} \cdot (\vec{\nabla} \times \vec{A})\, d^3x$ is taken over a volume $V$ bounded by a surface $\Sigma$. When the vector field $\vec{A}$ is changed to $\vec{A} + \vec{\nabla}\Lambda$, the integral changes to $I + \Delta I$. Then $\Delta I$ can be expressed as:
